Fintech refers to technology-enabled financial innovation.
Variance Analysis: If Actual Cost > Standard Cost, the variance is ______.
If Actual Profit > Budgeted Profit, the variance is ______.
Reconciling Budgeted to Actual Profit: Start with Budgeted, Add Favorable, Subtract Adverse.
Rearrange the Profit Reconciliation statement:
Operating Statement (Marginal Costing) reconciles Contribution first.
In Marginal Costing Operating Statement, Fixed Overhead variance is only an Expenditure variance.
Absorption Costing adds Fixed Overhead Volume Variance to reconcile profit.
Performance Pyramid links strategy to operations.
Building Block Model (Fitzgerald & Moon) is designed for service businesses.
Which is a 'Dimension' in Building Block Model?
Building Block Model: 'Determinants' are Quality, Flexibility, Innovation, Resource Utilization.
Building Block Model: 'Results' are Financial Performance and ______.
Performance Prism has 5 facets.
Rearrange the Performance Prism facets:
Divisional Performance: High Transfer Pricing increases selling division's profit.
Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) considers impact on environment and society.
Triple Bottom Line consists of People, Planet, and ______.
Sustainability reporting is increasingly mandatory.
Integrated Reporting (<IR>) combines financial and non-financial value creation.
Short-termism focuses on immediate profit at the expense of long-term value.
ROI can encourage short-termism (e.g., delaying investment to keep asset base low).
Non-financial indicators (NFPIs) effectively balance short-term financial measures.
RI is generally considered better than ROI for goal congruence.
Economic Value Added (EVA) is a specific version of Residual Income.
EVA calculates NOPAT - (WACC x Capital Employed).
NOPAT stands for Net Operating Profit After ______.
Compounding frequency: Nominal rate is the stated annual rate.
Effective Annual Rate (EAR) takes compounding into account.
If nominal rate is 10% compounded semi-annually, periodic rate is ______%.
Perpetuity is a constant cash flow that continues forever.
PV of Perpetuity = Annual Cash Flow / ______.
Advanced Manufacturing Technology (AMT) includes CAD, CAM, and Robotics.
FMS stands for Flexible ______ System.
CIM (Computer Integrated Manufacturing) links design, planning, and production.
MRP I stands for Material Requirements Planning.
MRP II stands for Manufacturing ______ Planning.
ERP extends MRP II to the whole organization.
Optimized Production Technology (OPT) focuses on removing bottlenecks.
Spreadsheet Macros are used to automate repetitive tasks.
Pivot Tables are used for summarizing and analyzing large datasets.
Goal Seek finds the input value needed to achieve a specific output.
Solver is an advanced version of Goal Seek for multiple variables.
Cost hierarchy: Product-sustaining costs are incurred regardless of the number of units or batches.
Cost hierarchy: Facility-sustaining costs are incurred to support the organization as a whole.
Throughput Accounting: Factory costs are treated as fixed costs.
Environmental cost: 'Contingent costs' depend on future events (e.g., fines).
Environmental cost: 'Image and Relationship costs' affect the reputation of the company.
Target Costing: Allowable Cost = Target Price - Target ______.
Target Cost Gap = Estimated Cost - ______ Cost.
Life Cycle Costing: Most costs are committed during the ______ phase.
Just-in-Time (JIT) production reduces inventory holding costs.
JIT requires high quality suppliers and reliable delivery.
Backflush Accounting delays recording costs until goods are completed or sold.
Kaizen Costing focuses on continuous small improvements during production.
Benchmarking types: Process benchmarking focuses on discrete work processes.
Balanced Scorecard: Leading indicators predict future performance.
Balanced Scorecard: Lagging indicators report past performance.
Customer satisfaction survey is a ______ indicator.
Financial ratios (like ROCE) are typically ______ indicators.
Not-for-profit organizations prioritize 'Value for Money' over profit maximization.
Standard deviation measures the spread around the mean.
Variance is the square of the standard deviation.
Coefficient of determination (r2) is always between 0 and 1.
Time series: 'Trend' represents the long-term movement.
Time series: 'Cyclical' variation is associated with economic cycles.
Probability: Two events are mutually exclusive if they cannot happen at the same time.
Probability: Two events are independent if the outcome of one does not affect the other.
Expected Value is a long-run weighted average.
Normal distribution is symmetrical and bell-shaped.
Z-score measures how many standard deviations a value is from the mean.
Spreadsheet: 'VLOOKUP' searches for a value in the first column of a table.
Spreadsheet: 'IF' function returns one value if true and another if false.
A 'dashboard' provides a visual overview of key performance indicators.
